translated: I am Bhrigu among the great sages, and among words I am the one syllable (Om).

original: yajñānāṃ japayajño 'smi sthāvarāṇāṃ himālayaḥ
analyzed: yajñānām japa yajñaḥ smi sthāvarāṇām himālayaḥ
translated: I am the sacrifice of muttering (Japa) among sacrifices, and among the immovable I am the Himalaya (mountain).

original: aśvatthaḥ sarvavṛkṣāṇāṃ devarṣīṇāṃ ca nāradaḥ
analyzed: aśvatthaḥ sarva vṛkṣāṇām deva ṛṣīṇām ca nāradaḥ
translated: I am the Ashvattha among all trees, and among the celestial sages I am Narada.

original: gandharvāṇāṃ citrarathaḥ siddhānāṃ kapilo muniḥ
analyzed: gandharvāṇām citrarathaḥ siddhānām kapilaḥ muniḥ
translated: I am Chitraratha among the Gandharvas, and among the Siddhas I am the sage Kapila.

original: uccaiḥśravasam aśvānāṃ viddhi mām amṛtodbhavam
analyzed: uccaiḥśravasam aśvānām viddhi mām amṛta udbhavam
translated: Know me to be Uchchaishrava among the horses, born from the nectar.

original: airāvataṃ gajendrāṇāṃ narāṇāṃ ca narādhipam
analyzed: airāvatam gaja indrāṇām narāṇām ca narādhipam
translated: I am Airavata among the lords of elephants, and among men I am the king.

original: āyudhānām ahaṃ vajraṃ dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
analyzed: āyudhānām aham vajram dhenūnām asmi kāmadhuk
translated: I am the thunderbolt among weapons, and among cows I am the wish-fulfilling cow (Kamadhenu).

original: prajanaś cāsmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
analyzed: prajanaḥ ca asmi kandarpaḥ sarpāṇām asmi vāsukiḥ
translated: And I am the procreator (Prajana) Kandarpa, and among serpents I am Vasuki.

original: anantaś cāsmi nāgānāṃ varuṇo yādasām aham
analyzed: anantaḥ ca asmi nāgānām varuṇaḥ yādasām aham
translated: And I am Ananta among the Nagas, and I am Varuna among the waters.

original: pitṝṇām aryamā cāsmi yamaḥ saṃyamatām aham
analyzed: pitṝṇām aryamā ca asmi yamaḥ saṃyamatām aham
translated: I am Aryaman among the manes, and I am Yama among the controllers.

original: prahlādaś cāsmi daityānāṃ kālaḥ kalayatām aham
analyzed: prahlādaḥ ca asmi daityānām kālaḥ kalayatām aham
translated: And I am Prahlada among the Daityas, and I am Kala among the measurers.

original: mṛgāṇāṃ ca mṛgendro 'haṃ vainateyaś ca pakṣiṇām
analyzed: mṛgāṇām ca mṛgendraḥ ham vainateyaḥ ca pakṣiṇām
translated: I am the lord of beasts among the beasts, and among the birds I am Garuda.

original: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastrabhṛtām aham
analyzed: pavanaḥ pavatām asmi rāmaḥ śastrabhṛtām aham
translated: I am the wind among the winds, and I am Rama among the wielders of weapons.

original: jhaṣāṇāṃ makaraś cāsmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
analyzed: jhaṣāṇām makaraḥ ca asmi srotasām asmi jāhnavī
translated: Of the fishes I am the shark, of the rivers I am the Ganga.

original: sargāṇām ādir antaś ca madhyaṃ caivāham arjuna🔽adhyātmavidyā vidyānāṃ vādaḥ pravadatām aham
analyzed: sargāṇām ādiḥ antaḥ ca madhyam ca eva aham arjuna  adhyātma vidyā vidyānām vādaḥ pravadatām aham
translated: I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings, O Arjuna.

original: akṣarāṇām akāro 'smi dvaṃdvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca🔽aham evākṣayaḥ kālo dhātāhaṃ viśvatomukhaḥ
analyzed: akṣarāṇām akāraḥ smi dvaṃdvaḥ sāmāsikasya ca  aham eva akṣayaḥ kālaḥ dhātā aham viśvatomukhaḥ
translated: Of the sciences I am the knowledge of the soul; of the letters I am the syllable 'A'; of the compounds I am the dvandva (copulative).🔽I alone am the imperishable time, the dispenser of all, and I am the all-devouring death.

original: mṛtyuḥ sarvaharaś cāham udbhavaś ca bhaviṣyatām
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ sarva haraḥ ca aham udbhavaḥ ca bhaviṣyatām
translated: I am the birth of all that is to be born.

original: kīrtiḥ śrīr vāk ca nārīṇāṃ smṛtir medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
analyzed: kīrtiḥ śrīḥ vāc ca nārīṇām smṛtiḥ medhā dhṛtiḥ kṣamā
translated: Of the women I am Lakshmi, speech, memory, intelligence, patience and forgiveness.

original: bṛhatsāma tathā sāmnāṃ gāyatrī chandasām aham🔽māsānāṃ mārgaśīrṣo 'ham ṛtūnāṃ kusumākaraḥ
analyzed: bṛhatsāma tathā sāmnām gāyatrī chandasām aham  māsānām mārgaśīrṣaḥ ham ṛtūnām kusumākaraḥ
translated: Of the Samans I am the Brihat-Sama; of the metres I am the Gâyatrî.🔽Of the months I am the month of Mârgasîrsha (November-December); of the seasons I am the spring.

original: dyūtaṃ chalayatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham
analyzed: dyūtam chalayatām asmi tejaḥ tejasvinām aham
translated: Of the gamblers I am the play; of the learned I am the knowledge; of the ascetics I am the renunciation.

original: jayo 'smi vyavasāyo 'smi sattvaṃ sattvavatām aham
analyzed: jayaḥ smi vyavasāyaḥ smi sattvam sattvavatām aham
translated: Of the victorious I am the resolution; of the strong I am the strength, devoid of passion.

original: vṛṣṇīnāṃ vāsudevo 'smi pāṇḍavānāṃ dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṇīnām vāsudevaḥ smi pāṇḍavānām dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Of the Vrishnis I am Vasudeva; of the Pandavas I am Dhananjaya.

original: munīnām apy ahaṃ vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanā kaviḥ
analyzed: munīnām api aham vyāsaḥ kavīnām uśanāḥ kaviḥ
translated: Of the sages I am Vyasa; of the poets I am the poet Ushanâ.

original: daṇḍo damayatām asmi nītir asmi jigīṣatām
analyzed: daṇḍaḥ damayatām asmi nītiḥ asmi jigīṣatām
translated: Of the punishers I am the punishment; of the conquerors I am the policy.

original: maunaṃ caivāsmi guhyānāṃ jñānaṃ jñānavatām aham
analyzed: maunam ca eva asmi guhyānām jñānam jñānavatām aham
translated: Of the secrets I am the silence; of the learned I am the knowledge.

original: yac cāpi sarvabhūtānāṃ bījaṃ tad aham arjuna🔽na tad asti vinā yat syān mayā bhūtaṃ carācaram
analyzed: yat ca api sarva bhūtānām bījam tat aham arjuna  na tat asti vinā yat syāt mayā bhūtam carācaram
translated: And, O Arjuna, that which is the seed of all beings,🔽there is nothing moving or unmoving that exists without Me.

original: nānto 'sti mama divyānāṃ vibhūtīnāṃ paraṃtapa
analyzed: na antaḥ sti mama divyānām vibhūtīnām paraṃtapa
translated: There is no end, O scorcher of enemies, to My divine manifestations.

original: eṣa tūddeśataḥ prokto vibhūter vistaro mayā
analyzed: eṣa tu uddeśataḥ proktaḥ vibhūteḥ vistaraḥ mayā
translated: This much has been stated by Me as an indication of My manifestations.

original: yad yad vibhūtimat sattvaṃ śrīmad ūrjitam eva vā
analyzed: yat yat vibhūtimat sattvam śrīmat ūrjitam eva vā
translated: Whatever is glorious, powerful, or majestic,

original: tat tad evāvagaccha tvaṃ mama tejoṃśasaṃbhavam
analyzed: tat tat eva avagaccha tvam mama tejaḥ oṃśa saṃbhavam
translated: know that to have originated from a part of My splendor.

original: atha vā bahunaitena kiṃ jñātena tavārjuna
analyzed: atha vā bahunā etena kim jñātena tava arjuna
translated: Or, what is the use of knowing this much, O Arjuna?

original: viṣṭabhyāham idaṃ kṛtsnam ekāṃśena sthito jagat
analyzed: viṣṭabhya aham idam kṛtsnam eka aṃśena sthitaḥ jagat
translated: I stand holding this entire world with one part of Myself.

original: arjuna uvāca🔽madanugrahāya paramaṃ guhyam adhyātmasaṃjñitam
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca  mad anugrahāya paramam guhyam adhyātma saṃjñitam
translated: Arjuna said:🔽For my favor, You have spoken the supreme secret known as spiritual knowledge,

original: yat tvayoktaṃ vacas tena moho 'yaṃ vigato mama
analyzed: yat tvayā uktam vacaḥ tena mohaḥ yam vigataḥ mama
translated: by which this delusion of mine has gone away.

original: bhavāpyayau hi bhūtānāṃ śrutau vistaraśo mayā
analyzed: bhava apyayau hi bhūtānām śrutau vistaraśaḥ mayā
translated: I have heard in detail about the birth and death of beings,

original: tvattaḥ kamalapatrākṣa māhātmyam api cāvyayam
analyzed: tvattaḥ kamala patra akṣa māhātmyam api ca avyayam
translated: and from You, O lotus-eyed one, the imperishable greatness as well.

original: evam etad yathāttha tvam ātmānaṃ parameśvara
analyzed: evam etat yathā āttha tvam ātmānam parameśvara
translated: It is so, as You have said, O Supreme Lord,

original: draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaraṃ puruṣottama
analyzed: draṣṭum icchāmi te rūpam aiśvaram puruṣottama
translated: I wish to see Your divine form, O Supreme Person.

original: manyase yadi tac chakyaṃ mayā draṣṭum iti prabho
analyzed: manyase yadi tat śakyam mayā draṣṭum iti prabho
translated: O Lord, if you think that it is possible for me to see that,

original: yogeśvara tato me tvaṃ darśayātmānam avyayam
analyzed: yogeśvara tatas me tvam darśaya ātmānam avyayam
translated: then, O Lord of Yoga, show me your imperishable self.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi śataśo 'tha sahasraśaḥ
analyzed: paśya me pārtha rūpāṇi sahasraśas
translated: See, O son of Prtha, my forms in hundreds and thousands,

original: nānāvidhāni divyāni nānāvarṇākṛtīni ca
analyzed: nānāvidhāni divyāni nānā varṇa ākṛtīni ca
translated: of various kinds, divine, of various colors and shapes.

original: paśyādityān vasūn rudrān aśvinau marutas tathā
analyzed: paśya ādityān vasūn rudrān aśvinau marutaḥ tathā
translated: See the Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Ashvins, and the Maruts,

original: bahūny adṛṣṭapūrvāṇi paśyāścaryāṇi bhārata
analyzed: bahūni a dṛṣṭa pūrvāṇi paśya āścaryāṇi bhārata
translated: and many other things never seen before, O Bhārata.

original: ihaikasthaṃ jagat kṛtsnaṃ paśyādya sacarācaram
analyzed: iha ekastham jagat kṛtsnam paśya adya sacarācaram
translated: See here the entire universe, with its moving and unmoving creatures,

original: mama dehe guḍākeśa yac cānyad draṣṭum icchasi
analyzed: mama dehe guḍākeśa yat ca anyat draṣṭum icchasi
translated: existing in my body, O Gudakesha, and whatever else you wish to see.

original: na tu māṃ śakyase draṣṭum anenaiva svacakṣuṣā
analyzed: na tu mām śakyase draṣṭum anena eva sva cakṣuṣā
translated: But you are not able to see me with this eye of yours.

original: divyaṃ dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogam aiśvaram
analyzed: divyam dadāmi te cakṣuḥ paśya me yogam aiśvaram
translated: I will give you the divine eye. See my divine Yoga.

original: saṃjaya uvāca
analyzed: saṃjayaḥ uvāca
translated: Sanjaya said:

original: evam uktvā tato rājan mahāyogeśvaro hariḥ
analyzed: evam uktvā tatas rājan mahā yoga īśvaraḥ hariḥ
translated: Having said this, O king, Hari, the great Lord of Yoga,

original: darśayām āsa pārthāya paramaṃ rūpam aiśvaram
analyzed: darśayām āsa pārthāya paramam rūpam aiśvaram
translated: showed Partha his supreme, divine form,

original: anekavaktranayanam anekādbhutadarśanam🔽anekadivyābharaṇaṃ divyānekodyatāyudham
analyzed: aneka vaktra nayanam aneka adbhuta darśanam  aneka divya ābharaṇam divya aneka udyata āyudham
translated: with many faces and eyes, with many wonders,🔽with many divine ornaments, with many divine, raised weapons,

original: divyamālyāmbaradharaṃ divyagandhānulepanam
analyzed: divya mālya ambara dharam divya gandha anulepanam
translated: wearing divine garlands and garments, anointed with divine fragrances,

original: sarvāścaryamayaṃ devam anantaṃ viśvatomukham
analyzed: sarva āścarya mayam devam anantam viśvatomukham
translated: The god who is full of all wonders, infinite, with faces everywhere,

original: divi sūryasahasrasya bhaved yugapad utthitā
analyzed: divi sūrya sahasrasya bhavet yugapad utthitā
translated: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst forth simultaneously in the sky,

original: yadi bhāḥ sadṛśī sā syād bhāsas tasya mahātmanaḥ
analyzed: yadi bhās sadṛśī sā syāt bhāsaḥ tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: That would be similar to the splendor of that great soul.

original: tatraikasthaṃ jagat kṛtsnaṃ pravibhaktam anekadhā
analyzed: tatra ekastham jagat kṛtsnam pravibhaktam anekadhā
translated: There, the entire universe, divided into many ways,

original: apaśyad devadevasya śarīre pāṇḍavas tadā
analyzed: apaśyat devadevasya śarīre pāṇḍavaḥ tadā
translated: The son of Pandu saw in the body of the god of gods.

original: tataḥ sa vismayāviṣṭo hṛṣṭaromā dhanaṃjayaḥ
analyzed: tatas sa vismaya āviṣṭaḥ hṛṣṭa romā dhanaṃjayaḥ
translated: Then, filled with wonder, with hair standing on end,

original: praṇamya śirasā devaṃ kṛtāñjalir abhāṣata
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā devam kṛtāñjaliḥ abhāṣata
translated: Having bowed his head to the god, with folded hands, he spoke:

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: paśyāmi devāṃs tava deva dehe /
analyzed: paśyāmi devān tava deva dehe
translated: I see all the gods in your body, O god,

original: sarvāṃs tathā bhūtaviśeṣasaṃghān
analyzed: sarvān tathā bhūta viśeṣa saṃghān
translated: And the multitudes of various beings,

original: brahmāṇam īśaṃ kamalāsanastham /
analyzed: brahmāṇam īśam kamalāsana stham
translated: Brahma, the lord, seated on a lotus,

original: ṛṣīṃś ca sarvān uragāṃś ca divyān
analyzed: ṛṣīn ca sarvān uragān ca divyān
translated: And all the sages, and the divine serpents,

original: anekabāhūdaravaktranetraṃ /
analyzed: aneka bāhu udara vaktra netram
translated: With many arms, bellies, mouths, and eyes,

original: paśyāmi tvā sarvato 'nantarūpam
analyzed: paśyāmi tvā sarvatas nanta rūpam
translated: I see you everywhere, with an infinite form.

original: nāntaṃ na madhyaṃ na punas tavādiṃ /
analyzed: na antam na madhyam na punar tava ādim
translated: I do not see your end, middle, or beginning,

original: paśyāmi viśveśvara viśvarūpa
analyzed: paśyāmi viśveśvara viśvarūpa
translated: O lord of the universe, with a universal form.

original: kirīṭinaṃ gadinaṃ cakriṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: kirīṭinam gadinam cakriṇam ca
translated: Crowned, holding a mace and a discus,

original: tejorāśiṃ sarvato dīptimantam
analyzed: tejaḥ rāśim sarvatas dīptimantam
translated: A mass of radiance, shining everywhere,

original: paśyāmi tvāṃ durnirīkṣyaṃ samantād /
analyzed: paśyāmi tvām durnirīkṣyam samantāt
translated: I see you as unapproachable on all sides.

original: dīptānalārkadyutim aprameyam
analyzed: dīpta anala arka dyutim aprameyam
translated: You are the immeasurable one, whose radiance is like the blazing fire and the sun,

analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: dṛṣṭvedaṃ mānuṣaṃ rūpaṃ tava saumyaṃ janārdana
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā idam mānuṣam rūpam tava saumyam janārdana
translated: Having seen this gentle human form of yours, O Janardana,

original: idānīm asmi saṃvṛttaḥ sacetāḥ prakṛtiṃ gataḥ
analyzed: idānīm asmi saṃvṛttaḥ sa cetāḥ prakṛtim gataḥ
translated: Now I have become composed and have regained my natural state.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: sudurdarśam idaṃ rūpaṃ dṛṣṭavān asi yan mama
analyzed: su durdarśam idam rūpam dṛṣṭavān asi yat mama
translated: You have seen this form of mine, which is very difficult to see,

original: devā apy asya rūpasya nityaṃ darśanakāṅkṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: devāḥ api asya rūpasya nityam darśana kāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: Even the gods always desire to see this form of mine.

original: nāhaṃ vedair na tapasā na dānena na cejyayā
analyzed: na aham vedaiḥ na tapasā na dānena na ca ijyayā
translated: I cannot be seen by means of the Vedas, austerities, charity, or sacrifices,

original: śakya evaṃvidho draṣṭuṃ dṛṣṭavān asi māṃ yathā
analyzed: śakyaḥ evaṃvidhaḥ draṣṭum dṛṣṭavān asi mām yathā
translated: In this way, as you have seen me.

original: bhaktyā tv ananyayā śakya aham evaṃvidho 'rjuna
analyzed: bhaktyā tu an anyayā śakyaḥ aham evaṃvidhaḥ rjuna
translated: But by single-minded devotion, O Arjuna,

original: jñātuṃ draṣṭuṃ ca tattvena praveṣṭuṃ ca paraṃtapa
analyzed: jñātum draṣṭum ca tattvena praveṣṭum ca paraṃtapa
translated: I can be known and seen in reality, and entered into, O scorcher of enemies.

original: matkarmakṛn matparamo madbhaktaḥ saṅgavarjitaḥ
translated: One who performs actions for Me, who is devoted to Me, who worships Me, who is free from attachment,

original: nirvairaḥ sarvabhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava
analyzed: nirvairaḥ sarva bhūteṣu yaḥ sa mām eti pāṇḍava
translated: O son of Pandu, he who is free from enmity towards all beings, he comes to Me.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: evaṃ satatayuktā ye bhaktās tvāṃ paryupāsate
analyzed: evam satata yuktāḥ ye bhaktāḥ tvām paryupāsate
translated: Those who are always thus devoted and worship You,

original: ye cāpy akṣaram avyaktaṃ teṣāṃ ke yogavittamāḥ
analyzed: ye ca api akṣaram avyaktam teṣām ke yoga vittamāḥ
translated: and those who meditate on the imperishable and unmanifest - who among them are the best knowers of yoga?

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: mayy āveśya mano ye māṃ nityayuktā upāsate
analyzed: mayi āveśya manaḥ ye mām nitya yuktāḥ upāsate
translated: Those who, fixing their minds on Me, worship Me, ever devoted,

original: śraddhayā parayopetās te me yuktatamā matāḥ
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā upetāḥ te me yuktatamāḥ matāḥ
translated: endowed with supreme faith, they are considered by Me to be the most devoted.

original: ye tv akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktaṃ paryupāsate
analyzed: ye tu akṣaram anirdeśyam avyaktam paryupāsate
translated: But those who meditate on the imperishable, the indescribable, the unmanifest,

original: sarvatragam acintyaṃ ca kūṭastham acalaṃ dhruvam
analyzed: sarvatragam acintyam ca kūṭastham acalam dhruvam
translated: which is all-pervading, inconceivable, the support, immovable, and eternal,

original: saṃniyamyendriyagrāmaṃ sarvatra samabuddhayaḥ
analyzed: saṃniyamya indriya grāmam sarvatra sama buddhayaḥ
translated: restraining the group of senses, with an equal mind everywhere,

original: te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarvabhūtahite ratāḥ
analyzed: te prāpnuvanti mām eva sarva bhūta hite ratāḥ
translated: they attain Me alone, engaged in the welfare of all beings.

original: kleśo 'dhikataras teṣām avyaktāsaktacetasām
analyzed: kleśaḥ dhikataraḥ teṣām avyakta āsakta cetasām
translated: For those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, the difficulty is greater,

original: avyaktā hi gatir duḥkhaṃ dehavadbhir avāpyate
analyzed: avyaktā hi gatiḥ duḥkham dehavadbhiḥ avāpyate
translated: for the goal of the unmanifest is attained with difficulty by those who have bodies.

original: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya matparāḥ
analyzed: ye tu sarvāṇi karmāṇi mayi saṃnyasya mad parāḥ
translated: But those who, dedicating all actions to Me, are devoted to Me,

original: ananyenaiva yogena māṃ dhyāyanta upāsate
analyzed: an anyena eva yogena mām dhyāyantaḥ upāsate
translated: meditating on Me with single-pointed concentration and worshipping Me,

original: teṣām ahaṃ samuddhartā mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarāt
analyzed: teṣām aham samuddhartā mṛtyu saṃsāra sāgarāt
translated: I am their deliverer from the ocean of birth and death, from the world.

original: bhavāmi nacirāt pārtha mayy āveśitacetasām
analyzed: bhavāmi nacirāt pārtha mayi āveśita cetasām
translated: I become soon, O son of Prtha, of those who have fixed their minds on Me.

original: mayy eva mana ādhatsva mayi buddhiṃ niveśaya
analyzed: mayi eva manaḥ ādhatsva mayi buddhim niveśaya
translated: Fix your mind on Me alone, direct your intellect on Me.

original: nivasiṣyasi mayy eva ata ūrdhvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ
analyzed: nivasiṣyasi mayi eva atas ūrdhvam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: You will thus dwell in Me alone, there is no doubt about it, O son of Prtha.

original: atha cittaṃ samādhātuṃ na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram
analyzed: atha cittam samādhātum na śaknoṣi mayi sthiram
translated: But if you are unable to fix your mind firmly on Me,

original: abhyāsayogena tato mām icchāptuṃ dhanaṃjaya
analyzed: abhyāsa yogena tatas mām iccha āptum dhanaṃjaya
translated: then, O Dhananjaya, strive to attain Me by the yoga of devotion.

original: abhyāse 'py asamartho 'si matkarmaparamo bhava
analyzed: abhyāse pi si mad karma paramaḥ bhava
translated: If you are unable to practice, then be devoted to My actions.

original: madartham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
analyzed: mad artham api karmāṇi kurvan siddhim avāpsyasi
translated: By performing actions for My sake, you will attain perfection.

original: athaitad apy aśakto 'si kartuṃ madyogam āśritaḥ
analyzed: athā etat api aśaktaḥ si kartum mad yogam āśritaḥ
translated: But if you are unable to do even this, resorting to My yoga,

original: sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ tataḥ kuru yatātmavān
analyzed: sarva karma phala tyāgam tatas kuru yata ātmavān
translated: then, with a controlled self, renounce the fruits of all actions.

original: śreyo hi jñānam abhyāsāj jñānād dhyānaṃ viśiṣyate
analyzed: śreyaḥ hi jñānam abhyāsāt jñānāt dhyānam viśiṣyate
translated: For knowledge is better than practice, and meditation is superior to knowledge.

original: dhyānāt karmaphalatyāgas tyāgāc chāntir anantaram
translated: From meditation comes the renunciation of the fruits of action, and after renunciation comes peace.

original: adveṣṭā sarvabhūtānāṃ maitraḥ karuṇa eva ca
analyzed: a dveṣṭā sarva bhūtānām maitraḥ karuṇaḥ eva ca
translated: He who is free from hatred towards all beings, friendly, compassionate,

original: nirmamo nirahaṃkāraḥ samaduḥkhasukhaḥ kṣamī
translated: free from possessiveness and egoism, equal in pain and pleasure, tolerant,

original: saṃtuṣṭaḥ satataṃ yogī yatātmā dṛḍhaniścayaḥ
analyzed: saṃtuṣṭaḥ satatam yogī yata ātmā dṛḍha niścayaḥ
translated: always contented, a yogi, with a controlled self, firm in resolve,

original: mayy arpitamanobuddhir yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
analyzed: mayi arpita manaḥ buddhiḥ yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: whose mind and intellect are dedicated to Me, that devotee of Mine is dear to Me.

original: yasmān nodvijate loko lokān nodvijate ca yaḥ
analyzed: yasmāt na udvijate lokaḥ lokāt na udvijate ca yaḥ
translated: He from whom the world does not tremble, and by whom the world is not trembled,

original: harṣāmarṣabhayodvegair mukto yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
analyzed: harṣa amarṣa bhaya udvegaiḥ muktaḥ yaḥ sa ca me priyaḥ
translated: He who is free from joy, anger, fear and anxiety, he is dear to Me.

original: anapekṣaḥ śucir dakṣa udāsīno gatavyathaḥ
analyzed: anapekṣaḥ śuciḥ dakṣaḥ udāsīnaḥ gata vyathaḥ
translated: He who is indifferent, pure, skillful, neutral, free from pain,

original: sarvārambhaparityāgī yo madbhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
analyzed: sarva ārambha parityāgī yaḥ mad bhaktaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: He who has renounced all undertakings, he who is devoted to Me, he is dear to Me.

original: yo na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati
analyzed: yaḥ na hṛṣyati na dveṣṭi na śocati na kāṅkṣati
translated: He who is neither delighted nor hates, neither grieves nor desires,

original: śubhāśubhaparityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ
analyzed: śubha aśubha parityāgī bhaktimān yaḥ sa me priyaḥ
translated: He who has renounced good and bad, he who is full of devotion, he is dear to Me.

original: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā mānāvamānayoḥ
analyzed: samaḥ śatrau ca mitre ca tathā māna avamānayoḥ
translated: He who is the same to friend and foe, and also to honor and insult,

original: śītoṣṇasukhaduḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅgavivarjitaḥ
analyzed: śīta uṣṇa sukha duḥkheṣu samaḥ saṅga vivarjitaḥ
translated: He who is the same in cold, heat, happiness, sorrow, and is free from attachment,

original: tulyanindāstutir maunī saṃtuṣṭo yena kena cit
analyzed: tulya nindā stutiḥ maunī saṃtuṣṭaḥ yena kena cit
translated: He who is the same in praise and blame, who is silent, who is content with anything,

original: aniketaḥ sthiramatir bhaktimān me priyo naraḥ
analyzed: aniketaḥ sthira matiḥ bhaktimān me priyaḥ naraḥ
translated: Who is homeless, of steady mind, and full of devotion, that man is dear to Me.

original: ye tu dharmyāmṛtam idaṃ yathoktaṃ paryupāsate
analyzed: ye tu dharmya amṛtam idam yathā uktam paryupāsate
translated: But those who serve this nectar of righteousness as it has been taught,

original: śraddadhānā matparamā bhaktās te 'tīva me priyāḥ
analyzed: śraddadhānāḥ mad paramāḥ bhaktāḥ te tīva me priyāḥ
translated: With faith, with the highest devotion to Me, they are very dear to Me.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca🔽idaṃ śarīraṃ kaunteya kṣetram ity abhidhīyate
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  idam śarīram kaunteya kṣetram iti abhidhīyate
translated: The Blessed Lord said:🔽This body, O son of Kunti, is called the field.

original: etad yo vetti taṃ prāhuḥ kṣetrajña iti tadvidaḥ
analyzed: etat yaḥ vetti tam prāhuḥ kṣetrajñaḥ iti tad vidaḥ
translated: He who knows this, they call him the knower of the field, O knower of the truth.

original: kṣetrajñaṃ cāpi māṃ viddhi sarvakṣetreṣu bhārata
analyzed: kṣetrajñam ca api mām viddhi sarva kṣetreṣu bhārata
translated: And know Me to be the experiencer in all the fields, O descendant of Bharata.

original: kṣetrakṣetrajñayor jñānaṃ yat taj jñānaṃ mataṃ mama
analyzed: kṣetra kṣetrajñayoḥ jñānam yat tat jñānam matam mama
translated: The knowledge of the field and the experiencer, that is considered by Me to be knowledge.

original: tat kṣetraṃ yac ca yādṛk ca yadvikāri yataś ca yat
analyzed: tat kṣetram yat ca yādṛś ca yat vikāri yatas ca yat
translated: That field which is what, of what nature, what modifications, from what, and what it is,

original: sa ca yo yatprabhāvaś ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu
analyzed: sa ca yaḥ yad prabhāvaḥ ca tat samāsena me śṛṇu
translated: and who is that, and what its power is, listen to that in brief from Me.

original: ṛṣibhir bahudhā gītaṃ chandobhir vividhaiḥ pṛthak
analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ bahudhā gītam chandobhiḥ vividhaiḥ pṛthak
translated: It has been sung by the sages in many ways, with various kinds of meters, separately,

original: brahmasūtrapadaiś caiva hetumadbhir viniścitaiḥ
analyzed: brahmasūtra padaiḥ ca eva hetumadbhiḥ viniścitaiḥ
translated: and with the words of the Vedanta aphorisms, which are determined by reasoning.

original: mahābhūtāny ahaṃkāro buddhir avyaktam eva ca
analyzed: mahābhūtāni ahaṃkāraḥ buddhiḥ avyaktam eva ca
translated: The great elements, ego, intellect, and the unmanifest itself,

original: indriyāṇi daśaikaṃ ca pañca cendriyagocarāḥ
analyzed: indriyāṇi daśa ekam ca pañca ca indriya gocarāḥ
translated: the ten and one senses, and the five objects of the senses,

original: icchā dveṣaḥ sukhaṃ duḥkhaṃ saṃghātaś cetanā dhṛtiḥ
analyzed: icchā dveṣaḥ sukham duḥkham saṃghātaḥ cetanā dhṛtiḥ
translated: desire, aversion, happiness, sorrow, aggregation, consciousness, and fortitude,

original: etat kṣetraṃ samāsena savikāram udāhṛtam
analyzed: etat kṣetram samāsena sa vikāram udāhṛtam
translated: this field, in brief, is said to be with modifications.

original: amānitvam adambhitvam ahiṃsā kṣāntir ārjavam
analyzed: amāni tvam adambhi tvam ahiṃsā kṣāntiḥ ārjavam
translated: Humility, unpretentiousness, non-violence, forbearance, sincerity,

original: ācāryopāsanaṃ śaucaṃ sthairyam ātmavinigrahaḥ
analyzed: ācārya upāsanam śaucam sthairyam ātma vinigrahaḥ
translated: service to the teacher, purity, steadiness, self-control,

original: indriyārtheṣu vairāgyam anahaṃkāra eva ca
analyzed: indriya artheṣu vairāgyam anahaṃkāraḥ eva ca
translated: non-attachment to the objects of the senses, and absence of egoism,

original: janmamṛtyujarāvyādhiduḥkhadoṣānudarśanam
analyzed: janma mṛtyu jarā vyādhi duḥkha doṣa anudarśanam
translated: contemplation of the faults of birth, death, old age, disease, and sorrow,

original: asaktir anabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putradāragṛhādiṣu
analyzed: asaktiḥ anabhiṣvaṅgaḥ putra dāra gṛha ādiṣu
translated: non-attachment, non-identification, with regard to sons, wife, home, and so on,

original: nityaṃ ca samacittatvam iṣṭāniṣṭopapattiṣu
analyzed: nityam ca sama citta tvam iṣṭa aniṣṭa upapattiṣu
translated: And constant equanimity in the occurrence of the desirable and the undesirable,

original: mayi cānanyayogena bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī
analyzed: mayi ca an anya yogena bhaktiḥ avyabhicāriṇī
translated: And unwavering devotion to Me alone, without any other recourse,

original: viviktadeśasevitvam aratir janasaṃsadi
analyzed: vivikta deśa sevi tvam aratiḥ jana saṃsadi
translated: Dwelling in solitary places, dislike for a gathering of people,

original: adhyātmajñānanityatvaṃ tattvajñānārthadarśanam
translated: Constancy in the knowledge of the Self, and the vision of the truth of the knowledge of reality,

original: etaj jñānam iti proktam ajñānaṃ yad ato 'nyathā
analyzed: etat jñānam iti proktam ajñānam yat atas nyathā
translated: This is said to be knowledge; anything else is ignorance.

original: jñeyaṃ yat tat pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvāmṛtam aśnute
analyzed: jñeyam yat tat pravakṣyāmi yat jñātvā amṛtam aśnute
translated: I shall now speak of that which is to be known, knowing which one attains immortality.

original: anādimat paraṃ brahma na sat tan nāsad ucyate
analyzed: anādimat param brahma na sat tat na asat ucyate
translated: The beginningless supreme Brahman is said to be neither existent nor non-existent.

original: sarvataḥpāṇipādaṃ tat sarvatokṣiśiromukham
analyzed: sarvatas pāṇi pādam tat sarvatas akṣi śiraḥ mukham
translated: It has hands and feet everywhere, eyes, heads and faces everywhere,

original: sarvataḥśrutimal loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati
analyzed: sarvatas śrutimat loke sarvam āvṛtya tiṣṭhati
translated: It has ears everywhere in the world, and it stands pervading everything.

original: sarvendriyaguṇābhāsaṃ sarvendriyavivarjitam
analyzed: sarva indriya guṇa ābhāsam sarva indriya vivarjitam
translated: It manifests the qualities of all the senses, yet is devoid of all the senses,

original: asaktaṃ sarvabhṛc caiva nirguṇaṃ guṇabhoktṛ ca
analyzed: asaktam sarva bhṛt ca eva nirguṇam guṇa bhoktṛ ca
translated: It is unattached, yet supports everything, is attributeless, yet the experiencer of the qualities,

original: bahir antaś ca bhūtānām acaraṃ caram eva ca
analyzed: bahis antar ca bhūtānām acaram caram eva ca
translated: It is outside and inside of beings, unmoving, yet moving.

original: sūkṣmatvāt tad avijñeyaṃ dūrasthaṃ cāntike ca tat
analyzed: sūkṣma tvāt tat avijñeyam dūra stham ca antike ca tat
translated: It is not to be known because of its subtlety, yet it is far away and near.

original: avibhaktaṃ ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam
analyzed: avibhaktam ca bhūteṣu vibhaktam iva ca sthitam
translated: It is undivided among beings, yet it abides as if divided.

original: bhūtabhartṛ ca taj jñeyaṃ grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca
analyzed: bhūta bhartṛ ca tat jñeyam grasiṣṇu prabhaviṣṇu ca
translated: It should be known as the supporter and sustainer of beings, the all-devouring and all-powerful.

original: jyotiṣām api taj jyotis tamasaḥ param ucyate
analyzed: jyotiṣām api tat jyotiḥ tamasaḥ param ucyate
translated: That is the light of all lights, and is said to be beyond darkness.

original: jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ jñānagamyaṃ hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam
analyzed: jñānam jñeyam jñāna gamyam hṛdi sarvasya viṣṭhitam
translated: It is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and attainable through knowledge, and is situated in the heart of all.

original: iti kṣetraṃ tathā jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ coktaṃ samāsataḥ
analyzed: iti kṣetram tathā jñānam jñeyam ca uktam samāsatas
translated: Thus, the field, knowledge, and the object of knowledge have been succinctly described.

original: madbhakta etad vijñāya madbhāvāyopapadyate
analyzed: mad bhaktaḥ etat vijñāya mad bhāvāya upapadyate
translated: My devotee, knowing this, becomes fit for union with Me.

original: prakṛtiṃ puruṣaṃ caiva viddhy anādī ubhāv api
analyzed: prakṛtim puruṣam ca eva viddhi anādī ubhau api
translated: Know that both Prakriti and Purusha are without beginning.

original: vikārāṃś ca guṇāṃś caiva viddhi prakṛtisaṃbhavān
analyzed: vikārān ca guṇān ca eva viddhi prakṛti saṃbhavān
translated: Know that the modifications and the qualities originate from Prakriti.

original: kāryakāraṇakartṛtve hetuḥ prakṛtir ucyate
analyzed: kārya kāraṇa kartṛ tve hetuḥ prakṛtiḥ ucyate
translated: Prakriti is said to be the cause of the agency in action and its results.

original: puruṣaḥ sukhaduḥkhānāṃ bhoktṛtve hetur ucyate
analyzed: puruṣaḥ sukha duḥkhānām bhoktṛ tve hetuḥ ucyate
translated: Purusha is said to be the cause of the experience of pleasure and pain.

original: puruṣaḥ prakṛtistho hi bhuṅkte prakṛtijān guṇān
analyzed: puruṣaḥ prakṛti sthaḥ hi bhuṅkte prakṛti jān guṇān
translated: For, indeed, Purusha, abiding in Prakriti, experiences the qualities born of Prakriti.

original: kāraṇaṃ guṇasaṅgo 'sya sadasadyonijanmasu
analyzed: kāraṇam sat asat yoni janmasu
translated: Association with the qualities is the cause of his birth in good and bad wombs.

original: upadraṣṭānumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ
analyzed: upadraṣṭā anumantā ca bhartā bhoktā maheśvaraḥ
translated: He is the supreme Lord, the overseer, the sanctioner, the supporter, the enjoyer.

original: paramātmeti cāpy ukto dehe 'smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ
analyzed: paramātmā iti ca api uktaḥ dehe smin puruṣaḥ paraḥ
translated: He is also called the supreme Self, the supreme Person in this body.

original: ya evaṃ vetti puruṣaṃ prakṛtiṃ ca guṇaiḥ saha
analyzed: yaḥ evam vetti puruṣam prakṛtim ca guṇaiḥ saha
translated: He who knows thus the Person and Prakriti along with the qualities,

original: sarvathā vartamāno 'pi na sa bhūyo 'bhijāyate
analyzed: sarvathā vartamānaḥ pi na sa bhūyas bhijāyate
translated: however situated, is not born again.

original: dhyānenātmani paśyanti ke cid ātmānam ātmanā
analyzed: dhyānena ātmani paśyanti ke cid ātmānam ātmanā
translated: Some, by meditation, see the Self by the Self in the Self.

original: anye sāṃkhyena yogena karmayogena cāpare
analyzed: anye sāṃkhyena yogena karma yogena ca apare
translated: Others by the path of Sāṃkhya, others by the path of Yoga, and others by the path of action.

original: anye tv evam ajānantaḥ śrutvānyebhya upāsate
analyzed: anye tu evam a jānantaḥ śrutvā anyebhyaḥ upāsate
translated: But others, not knowing this, worship by listening to it from others.

original: te 'pi cātitaranty eva mṛtyuṃ śrutiparāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: te ca atitaranti eva mṛtyum śruti parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Even they, devoted to the Vedas, surely cross over death.

original: yāvat saṃjāyate kiṃ cit sattvaṃ sthāvarajaṅgamam
analyzed: yāvat saṃjāyate kim cit sattvam sthāvara jaṅgamam
translated: Whatever being is born, moving or unmoving,

original: kṣetrakṣetrajñasaṃyogāt tad viddhi bharatarṣabha
analyzed: kṣetra kṣetrajña saṃyogāt tat viddhi bharata ṛṣabha
translated: know that to be from the union of the field and the knower of the field, O best of the Bharatas.

original: samaṃ sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantaṃ parameśvaram
analyzed: samam sarveṣu bhūteṣu tiṣṭhantam parameśvaram
translated: The Supreme Lord, who abides equally in all beings,

original: vinaśyatsv avinaśyantaṃ yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
analyzed: vinaśyatsu a vinaśyantam yaḥ paśyati sa paśyati
translated: he who sees him as not perishing when they perish, he sees.

original: samaṃ paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram
analyzed: samam paśyan hi sarvatra samavasthitam īśvaram
translated: For one who sees the Lord as equal and abiding equally everywhere,

original: na hinasty ātmanātmānaṃ tato yāti parāṃ gatim
analyzed: na hinasti ātmanā ātmānam tatas yāti parām gatim
translated: he does not injure the Self by the Self, and then he attains the supreme goal.

original: prakṛtyaiva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśaḥ
analyzed: prakṛtyā eva ca karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni sarvaśas
translated: And all actions are performed by Prakṛti alone,

original: yaḥ paśyati tathātmānam akartāraṃ sa paśyati
analyzed: yaḥ paśyati tathā ātmānam akartāram sa paśyati
translated: he who sees thus sees the Self as not an agent.

original: yadā bhūtapṛthagbhāvam ekastham anupaśyati
analyzed: yadā bhūta pṛthagbhāvam ekastham anupaśyati
translated: When one sees the individualities of beings as united in one,

original: tata eva ca vistāraṃ brahma saṃpadyate tadā
analyzed: tatas eva ca vistāram brahma saṃpadyate tadā
translated: and from that very [oneness] their expansion, then one becomes united with Brahman.

original: anāditvān nirguṇatvāt paramātmāyam avyayaḥ
analyzed: anādi tvāt nirguṇa tvāt paramātmā ayam avyayaḥ
translated: This Supreme Self is without beginning and without qualities, and is imperishable.

original: śarīrastho 'pi kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
analyzed: kaunteya na karoti na lipyate
translated: Though abiding in the body, O son of Kunti, he does not act nor is he tainted.

original: yathā sarvagataṃ saukṣmyād ākāśaṃ nopalipyate
analyzed: yathā sarva gatam saukṣmyāt ākāśam na upalipyate
translated: Just as space, though all-pervading, is not soiled because of its subtlety,

original: sarvatrāvasthito dehe tathātmā nopalipyate🔽yathā prakāśayaty ekaḥ kṛtsnaṃ lokam imaṃ raviḥ
analyzed: sarvatra avasthitaḥ dehe tathā ātmā na upalipyate  yathā prakāśayati ekaḥ kṛtsnam lokam imam raviḥ
translated: so the Self, though present everywhere in the body, is not soiled.🔽Just as the one sun illuminates this whole world,

original: kṣetraṃ kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnaṃ prakāśayati bhārata
analyzed: kṣetram kṣetrī tathā kṛtsnam prakāśayati bhārata
translated: so the Self, O scion of the Bharata dynasty, illuminates the whole field of the embodied soul.

original: kṣetrakṣetrajñayor evam antaraṃ jñānacakṣuṣā
analyzed: kṣetra kṣetrajñayoḥ evam antaram jñānacakṣuṣā
translated: Thus, by the eye of knowledge, the difference between the field and the knower of the field,

original: bhūtaprakṛtimokṣaṃ ca ye vidur yānti te param
analyzed: bhūta prakṛti mokṣam ca ye viduḥ yānti te param
translated: and the liberation from the primordial nature of beings, is known. Those who know this attain the highest.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: paraṃ bhūyaḥ pravakṣyāmi jñānānāṃ jñānam uttamam
analyzed: param bhūyas pravakṣyāmi jñānānām jñānam uttamam
translated: I shall speak again of the knowledge, the most excellent of all knowledge,

original: yaj jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parāṃ siddhim ito gatāḥ
analyzed: yat jñātvā munayaḥ sarve parām siddhim itas gatāḥ
translated: knowing which all the sages have gone from here to the highest perfection.

original: idaṃ jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
analyzed: idam jñānam upāśritya mama sādharmyam āgatāḥ
translated: Relying on this knowledge, they have attained identity with Me.

original: sarge 'pi nopajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca
analyzed: sarge pi na upajāyante pralaye na vyathanti ca
translated: They are not born even at creation, nor do they suffer at dissolution.

original: mama yonir mahad brahma tasmin garbhaṃ dadhāmy aham
analyzed: mama yoniḥ mahat brahma tasmin garbham dadhāmi aham
translated: The great Brahman is My womb, and in that I place the seed.

original: saṃbhavaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ tato bhavati bhārata
analyzed: saṃbhavaḥ sarva bhūtānām tatas bhavati bhārata
translated: From that, O scion of the Bharata dynasty, the creation of all beings comes forth.

original: sarvayoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ saṃbhavanti yāḥ
analyzed: sarva yoniṣu kaunteya mūrtayaḥ saṃbhavanti yāḥ
translated: In all wombs, O son of Kunti, the forms that are born,

original: tāsāṃ brahma mahad yonir ahaṃ bījapradaḥ pitā
analyzed: tāsām brahma mahat yoniḥ aham bīja pradaḥ pitā
translated: of them Brahman is the great womb, and I am the father who gives the seed.

original: sattvaṃ rajas tama iti guṇāḥ prakṛtisaṃbhavāḥ
analyzed: sattvam rajaḥ tamaḥ iti guṇāḥ prakṛti saṃbhavāḥ
translated: Goodness, passion and darkness, born of Nature,

original: nibadhnanti mahābāho dehe dehinam avyayam
analyzed: nibadhnanti mahā bāho dehe dehinam avyayam
translated: bind the imperishable Self, O mighty-armed one, to the body, O son of Pandu.

original: tatra sattvaṃ nirmalatvāt prakāśakam anāmayam
analyzed: tatra sattvam nirmala tvāt prakāśakam anāmayam
translated: There, goodness, being pure, is illuminating and wholesome.

original: sukhasaṅgena badhnāti jñānasaṅgena cānagha
analyzed: sukha saṅgena badhnāti jñāna saṅgena ca anagha
translated: It binds through attachment to happiness and through attachment to knowledge, O sinless one.

original: rajo rāgātmakaṃ viddhi tṛṣṇāsaṅgasamudbhavam
analyzed: rajaḥ rāga ātmakam viddhi tṛṣṇā saṅga samudbhavam
translated: Know passion to be of the nature of attachment, arising from craving and clinging.

original: tan nibadhnāti kaunteya karmasaṅgena dehinam
analyzed: tat nibadhnāti kaunteya karma saṅgena dehinam
translated: It binds, O son of Kunti, through attachment to action, the embodied one.

original: tamas tv ajñānajaṃ viddhi mohanaṃ sarvadehinām
analyzed: tamaḥ tu ajñāna jam viddhi mohanam sarva dehinām
translated: But know darkness to be born of ignorance, deluding all embodied beings.

original: pramādālasyanidrābhis tan nibadhnāti bhārata
analyzed: pramāda ālasya nidrābhiḥ tat nibadhnāti bhārata
translated: It binds through heedlessness, laziness and sleep, O descendant of Bharata.

original: sattvaṃ sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
analyzed: sattvam sukhe sañjayati rajaḥ karmaṇi bhārata
translated: Goodness attracts to happiness, passion to action, O descendant of Bharata.

original: jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayaty uta
analyzed: jñānam āvṛtya tu tamaḥ pramāde sañjayati uta
translated: But darkness, covering knowledge, attracts to heedlessness.

original: rajas tamaś cābhibhūya sattvaṃ bhavati bhārata
analyzed: rajaḥ tamaḥ ca abhibhūya sattvam bhavati bhārata
translated: When goodness predominates over passion and darkness, then, O descendant of Bharata, goodness prevails.

original: rajaḥ sattvaṃ tamaś caiva tamaḥ sattvaṃ rajas tathā🔽sarvadvāreṣu dehe 'smin prakāśa upajāyate
analyzed: rajaḥ sattvam tamaḥ ca eva tamaḥ sattvam rajaḥ tathā  sarva dvāreṣu dehe smin prakāśaḥ upajāyate
translated: When passion and darkness are overcome by goodness, then passion and darkness are overcome by goodness.🔽When knowledge arises in all the sense-doors of this body,

original: jñānaṃ yadā tadā vidyād vivṛddhaṃ sattvam ity uta
analyzed: jñānam yadā tadā vidyāt vivṛddham sattvam iti uta
translated: then one should know that goodness has increased.

original: lobhaḥ pravṛttir ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā
analyzed: lobhaḥ pravṛttiḥ ārambhaḥ karmaṇām aśamaḥ spṛhā
translated: Greed, activity, undertaking of actions, restlessness, longing,

original: rajasy etāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharatarṣabha
analyzed: rajasi etāni jāyante vivṛddhe bharata ṛṣabha
translated: O best of the Bharata lineage, these are born when rajas is increased:

original: aprakāśo 'pravṛttiś ca pramādo moha eva ca
analyzed: pravṛttiḥ ca pramādaḥ mohaḥ eva ca
translated: Lack of light, lack of activity, negligence, and delusion,

original: tamasy etāni jāyante vivṛddhe kurunandana
analyzed: tamasi etāni jāyante vivṛddhe kuru nandana
translated: O descendant of Kuru, these are born when tamas is increased.

original: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayaṃ yāti dehabhṛt
analyzed: yadā sattve pravṛddhe tu pralayam yāti dehabhṛt
translated: But when a embodied being dissolves when sattva is increased,

original: tadottamavidāṃ lokān amalān pratipadyate
analyzed: tadā uttama vidām lokān amalān pratipadyate
translated: then he attains the stainless worlds of those who know the highest.

original: rajasi pralayaṃ gatvā karmasaṅgiṣu jāyate
analyzed: rajasi pralayam gatvā karma saṅgiṣu jāyate
translated: Having dissolved into rajas, he is born among those attached to action.

original: tathā pralīnas tamasi mūḍhayoniṣu jāyate
analyzed: tathā pralīnaḥ tamasi mūḍha yoniṣu jāyate
translated: Similarly, having dissolved into tamas, he is born in deluded wombs.

original: karmaṇaḥ sukṛtasyāhuḥ sāttvikaṃ nirmalaṃ phalam
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ su kṛtasya āhuḥ sāttvikam nirmalam phalam
translated: They say the fruit of good action is pure and belongs to sattva,

original: rajasas tu phalaṃ duḥkham ajñānaṃ tamasaḥ phalam
analyzed: rajasaḥ tu phalam duḥkham ajñānam tamasaḥ phalam
translated: but the fruit of rajas is suffering, and the fruit of tamas is ignorance.

original: sattvāt saṃjāyate jñānaṃ rajaso lobha eva ca
analyzed: sattvāt saṃjāyate jñānam rajasaḥ lobhaḥ eva ca
translated: From sattva, knowledge is born; from rajas, greed alone is born;

original: pramādamohau tamaso bhavato 'jñānam eva ca🔽ūrdhvaṃ gacchanti sattvasthā madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ
analyzed: pramāda mohau tamasaḥ bhavataḥ jñānam eva ca  ūrdhvam gacchanti sattva sthāḥ madhye tiṣṭhanti rājasāḥ
translated: from tamas, negligence, delusion, and ignorance are born.🔽Those established in sattva go upwards; those established in rajas stay in the middle;

original: jaghanyaguṇavṛttasthā adho gacchanti tāmasāḥ
analyzed: jaghanya guṇa vṛtta sthāḥ adhas gacchanti tāmasāḥ
translated: those established in the lowest quality go downwards.

original: nānyaṃ guṇebhyaḥ kartāraṃ yadā draṣṭānupaśyati
analyzed: na anyam guṇebhyaḥ kartāram yadā draṣṭā anupaśyati
translated: When the seer does not see any agent other than the qualities,

original: guṇebhyaś ca paraṃ vetti madbhāvaṃ so 'dhigacchati
analyzed: guṇebhyaḥ ca param vetti mad bhāvam saḥ dhigacchati
translated: and knows what is beyond the qualities, he attains My nature.

original: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī dehasamudbhavān
analyzed: guṇān etān atītya trīn dehī deha samudbhavān
translated: Having transcended these three qualities, which are born of the body, the embodied soul

original: janmamṛtyujarāduḥkhair vimukto 'mṛtam aśnute
analyzed: janma mṛtyu jarā duḥkhaiḥ vimuktaḥ mṛtam aśnute
translated: is freed from birth, death, old age and sorrow, and attains immortality.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: kair liṅgais trīn guṇān etān atīto bhavati prabho
analyzed: kaiḥ liṅgaiḥ trīn guṇān etān atītaḥ bhavati prabho
translated: By what signs is one who has transcended these three qualities, O Lord?

original: kimācāraḥ kathaṃ caitāṃs trīn guṇān ativartate
analyzed: kimācāraḥ katham ca etān trīn guṇān ativartate
translated: What is his conduct, and how does he transcend these three qualities?

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prakāśaṃ ca pravṛttiṃ ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava
analyzed: prakāśam ca pravṛttim ca moham eva ca pāṇḍava
translated: Light, activity and delusion, O son of Pandu,

original: na dveṣṭi saṃpravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati🔽udāsīnavad āsīno guṇair yo na vicālyate
analyzed: na dveṣṭi saṃpravṛttāni na nivṛttāni kāṅkṣati  udāsīna vat āsīnaḥ guṇaiḥ yaḥ na vicālyate
translated: he does not hate when they occur, nor does he long for them when they cease.🔽Sitting as if indifferent, he whom the qualities do not disturb,

original: guṇā vartanta ity eva yo 'vatiṣṭhati neṅgate🔽samaduḥkhasukhaḥ svasthaḥ samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ
analyzed: guṇāḥ vartante iti eva yaḥ vatiṣṭhati na iṅgate  sama duḥkha sukhaḥ svasthaḥ sama loṣṭa aśma kāñcanaḥ
translated: he who remains as a mere witness, not engaging in them,🔽equally bearing pain and pleasure, firm, regarding a clod, a stone and gold as the same,

original: tulyapriyāpriyo dhīras tulyanindātmasaṃstutiḥ
analyzed: tulya priya apriyaḥ dhīraḥ tulya nindā ātma saṃstutiḥ
translated: equally inclined towards the agreeable and the disagreeable, patient,

original: mānāvamānayos tulyas tulyo mitrāripakṣayoḥ
analyzed: māna avamānayoḥ tulyaḥ tulyaḥ mitra ari pakṣayoḥ
translated: equally regarding honor and dishonor, and regarding friends and foes as the same,

original: sarvārambhaparityāgī guṇātītaḥ sa ucyate
analyzed: sarva ārambha parityāgī guṇa atītaḥ saḥ ucyate
translated: renouncing all undertakings, he is said to have transcended the qualities.

original: māṃ ca yo 'vyabhicāreṇa bhaktiyogena sevate
analyzed: mām ca yaḥ vyabhicāreṇa bhakti yogena sevate
translated: And he who serves Me with unwavering devotion of yoga,

original: sa guṇān samatītyaitān brahmabhūyāya kalpate
analyzed: sa guṇān samatītya etān brahma bhūyāya kalpate
translated: he, having transcended these qualities, becomes fit for merging into Brahman.

original: brahmaṇo hi pratiṣṭhāham amṛtasyāvyayasya ca
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ hi pratiṣṭhā aham amṛtasya avyayasya ca
translated: For I am the support of Brahman, of immortality, of the imperishable,

original: śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasyaikāntikasya ca
analyzed: śāśvatasya ca dharmasya sukhasya aikāntikasya ca
translated: of eternal dharma, and of absolute bliss.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: ūrdhvamūlam adhaḥśākham aśvatthaṃ prāhur avyayam
analyzed: ūrdhva mūlam adhas śākham aśvattham prāhuḥ avyayam
translated: They call the fig tree with its roots above and branches below, imperishable.

original: chandāṃsi yasya parṇāni yas taṃ veda sa vedavit
analyzed: chandāṃsi yasya parṇāni yaḥ tam veda sa veda vid
translated: He who knows it is the knower of the Vedas, whose leaves are the Vedas.

original: adhaś cordhvaṃ prasṛtās tasya śākhā /
analyzed: adhas ca ūrdhvam prasṛtāḥ tasya śākhā
translated: Its branches spread upwards and downwards,

original: guṇapravṛddhā viṣayapravālāḥ🔽adhaś ca mūlāny anusaṃtatāni /
analyzed: guṇa pravṛddhāḥ viṣaya pravālāḥ  adhas ca mūlāni anusaṃtatāni
translated: nourished by the qualities and sprouting with objects.🔽Its roots, connected with action, extend downwards

original: karmānubandhīni manuṣyaloke
analyzed: karma anubandhīni manuṣya loke
translated: in the human world.

original: na rūpam asyeha tathopalabhyate /
analyzed: na rūpam asya iha tathā upalabhyate
translated: Its form is not perceived here in this way,

original: nānto na cādir na ca saṃpratiṣṭhā
analyzed: na antaḥ na ca ādiḥ na ca saṃpratiṣṭhā
translated: it has no end, no beginning, and no foundation.

original: aśvattham enaṃ suvirūḍhamūlam /
analyzed: aśvattham enam su virūḍha mūlam
translated: This fig tree with its roots well-established,

original: asaṅgaśastreṇa dṛḍhena chittvā
analyzed: asaṅga śastreṇa dṛḍhena chittvā
translated: having cut it down with the firm weapon of non-attachment,

original: tataḥ padaṃ tatparimārgitavyaṃ /
analyzed: tatas padam tat parimārgitavyam
translated: then that state should be sought,

original: yasmin gatā na nivartanti bhūyaḥ
analyzed: yasmin gatāḥ na nivartanti bhūyas
translated: to which, having gone, one does not return again.

original: tam eva cādyaṃ puruṣaṃ prapadye /
analyzed: tam eva ca ādyam puruṣam prapadye
translated: And I take refuge in that very primordial Purusha,

original: yataḥ pravṛttiḥ prasṛtā purāṇī
analyzed: yatas pravṛttiḥ prasṛtā purāṇī
translated: from whom the ancient activity has spread forth,

original: nirmānamohā jitasaṅgadoṣā /
analyzed: nirmāna mohā jita saṅga doṣā
translated: free from pride and delusion, having conquered the faults of attachment,

original: adhyātmanityā vinivṛttakāmāḥ
analyzed: adhyātma nityāḥ vinivṛtta kāmāḥ
translated: always devoted to the self, with desires turned away,

original: dvaṃdvair vimuktāḥ sukhaduḥkhasaṃjñair /
analyzed: dvaṃdvaiḥ vimuktāḥ sukha duḥkha saṃjñaiḥ
translated: freed from the pairs of opposites, with the notions of pleasure and pain.

original: gacchanty amūḍhāḥ padam avyayaṃ tat
analyzed: gacchanti amūḍhāḥ padam avyayam tat
translated: They go to that imperishable state, not deluded.

original: na tad bhāsayate sūryo na śaśāṅko na pāvakaḥ
analyzed: na tat bhāsayate sūryaḥ na śaśāṅkaḥ na pāvakaḥ
translated: The sun does not illuminate it, nor the moon nor fire.

original: yad gatvā na nivartante tad dhāma paramaṃ mama
analyzed: yat gatvā na nivartante tat dhāma paramam mama
translated: Having gone to which one does not return, that is My supreme abode.

original: mamaivāṃśo jīvaloke jīvabhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ
analyzed: mama eva aṃśaḥ jīva loke jīva bhūtaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: My own part, the eternal individual soul, is in the world of the living.

original: manaḥṣaṣṭhānīndriyāṇi prakṛtisthāni karṣati
analyzed: manaḥ ṣaṣṭhāni indriyāṇi prakṛti sthāni karṣati
translated: It draws along the senses which are situated in the nature, and which are six, with the mind as the seventh.

original: śarīraṃ yad avāpnoti yac cāpy utkrāmatīśvaraḥ
analyzed: śarīram yat avāpnoti yat ca api utkrāmati īśvaraḥ
translated: The Lord, when He takes up this body, and when He departs from it,

original: gṛhītvaitāni saṃyāti vāyur gandhān ivāśayāt
analyzed: gṛhītvā etāni saṃyāti vāyuḥ gandhān iva āśayāt
translated: carries these along, as the wind carries scent from the place (where it is).

original: śrotraṃ cakṣuḥ sparśanaṃ ca rasanaṃ ghrāṇam eva ca
analyzed: śrotram cakṣuḥ sparśanam ca rasanam ghrāṇam eva ca
translated: The ear, the eye, the touch, the taste, and also the smell,

original: adhiṣṭhāya manaś cāyaṃ viṣayān upasevate
analyzed: adhiṣṭhāya manaḥ ca ayam viṣayān upasevate
translated: having occupied these, this (soul) enjoys the objects of sense.

original: utkrāmantaṃ sthitaṃ vāpi bhuñjānaṃ vā guṇānvitam
analyzed: utkrāmantam sthitam vā api bhuñjānam vā guṇa anvitam
translated: Whether He is departing or staying, or whether He is enjoying, endowed with qualities,

original: vimūḍhā nānupaśyanti paśyanti jñānacakṣuṣaḥ🔽yatanto yoginaś cainaṃ paśyanty ātmany avasthitam
analyzed: vimūḍhāḥ na anupaśyanti paśyanti jñāna cakṣuṣaḥ  yatantaḥ yoginaḥ ca enam paśyanti ātmani avasthitam
translated: the deluded do not see Him. They see Him who have the eye of knowledge.🔽The yogis, striving, see Him abiding in the Self.

original: yatanto 'py akṛtātmāno nainaṃ paśyanty acetasaḥ🔽yad ādityagataṃ tejo jagad bhāsayate 'khilam
analyzed: yatantaḥ api akṛtātmānaḥ na enam paśyanti acetasaḥ  yat āditya gatam tejaḥ jagat bhāsayate khilam
translated: Even though striving, those who are not self-controlled, and who are without understanding, do not see Him.🔽That splendour which is in the sun, which illuminates the whole world,

original: yac candramasi yac cāgnau tat tejo viddhi māmakam
analyzed: yat candramasi yat ca agnau tat tejaḥ viddhi māmakam
translated: and that which is in the moon and in the fire, know that splendour to be Mine.

original: gām āviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmy aham ojasā
analyzed: gām āviśya ca bhūtāni dhārayāmi aham ojasā
translated: And entering the earth, I hold up all beings by my power.

original: puṣṇāmi cauṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somo bhūtvā rasātmakaḥ
analyzed: puṣṇāmi ca oṣadhīḥ sarvāḥ somaḥ bhūtvā rasa ātmakaḥ
translated: And becoming Soma, the essence of juices, I nourish all the herbs.

original: ahaṃ vaiśvānaro bhūtvā prāṇināṃ deham āśritaḥ
analyzed: aham vaiśvānaraḥ bhūtvā prāṇinām deham āśritaḥ
translated: Becoming Vaisvanara, I dwell in the bodies of living beings,

original: prāṇāpānasamāyuktaḥ pacāmy annaṃ caturvidham
analyzed: prāṇa apāna samāyuktaḥ pacāmi annam caturvidham
translated: endowed with inhalation and exhalation, and digest the four kinds of food.

original: sarvasya cāhaṃ hṛdi saṃniviṣṭo /
analyzed: sarvasya ca aham hṛdi saṃniviṣṭaḥ
translated: And I am present in the heart of all.

original: mattaḥ smṛtir jñānam apohanaṃ ca🔽vedaiś ca sarvair aham eva vedyo /
analyzed: mattaḥ smṛtiḥ jñānam apohanam ca  vedaiḥ ca sarvaiḥ aham eva vedyaḥ
translated: From Me are memory, knowledge and their loss.

original: vedāntakṛd vedavid eva cāham
analyzed: vedānta kṛt veda vid eva ca aham
translated: By all the Vedas I am to be known; I am the author of the Vedanta, and I am the knower of the Vedas.

original: dvāv imau puruṣau loke kṣaraś cākṣara eva ca
analyzed: dvau imau puruṣau loke kṣaraḥ ca akṣaraḥ eva ca
translated: There are these two in the world, the perishable and the imperishable.

original: kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭastho 'kṣara ucyate
analyzed: kṣaraḥ sarvāṇi bhūtāni kūṭasthaḥ kṣaraḥ ucyate
translated: The perishable is all beings; the immutable is said to be the Supreme.

original: uttamaḥ puruṣas tv anyaḥ paramātmety udāhṛtaḥ
analyzed: uttamaḥ puruṣaḥ tu anyaḥ paramātmā iti udāhṛtaḥ
translated: But there is another, the Supreme Person, called the Imperishable.

original: yo lokatrayam āviśya bibharty avyaya īśvaraḥ
analyzed: yaḥ lokatrayam āviśya bibharti avyayaḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: He, having entered the three worlds, supports them, the imperishable Lord.

original: yasmāt kṣaram atīto 'ham akṣarād api cottamaḥ
analyzed: yasmāt kṣaram atītaḥ ham akṣarāt api ca uttamaḥ
translated: Since I am beyond the perishable and also above the imperishable,

original: ato 'smi loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
analyzed: atas smi loke vede ca prathitaḥ puruṣottamaḥ
translated: therefore in the world and in the Veda I am proclaimed as the Supreme Person.

original: yo mām evam asaṃmūḍho jānāti puruṣottamam
analyzed: yaḥ mām evam asaṃmūḍhaḥ jānāti puruṣottamam
translated: He who, undeluded, thus knows Me as the Supreme Person,

original: sa sarvavid bhajati māṃ sarvabhāvena bhārata
analyzed: sa sarva vid bhajati mām sarva bhāvena bhārata
translated: he, O son of Bharata, knowing all, worships Me with all his being.

original: iti guhyatamaṃ śāstram idam uktaṃ mayānagha
analyzed: iti guhyatamam śāstram idam uktam mayā anagha
translated: Thus, O sinless one, this most secret doctrine has been declared by Me.

original: etad buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛtakṛtyaś ca bhārata
analyzed: etat buddhvā buddhimān syāt kṛtakṛtyaḥ ca bhārata
translated: Knowing this, one becomes wise and has accomplished his purpose, O descendant of Bharata.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: abhayaṃ sattvasaṃśuddhir jñānayogavyavasthitiḥ
translated: Fearlessness, purity of heart, perseverance in knowledge and yoga,

original: dānaṃ damaś ca yajñaś ca svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam
analyzed: dānam damaḥ ca yajñaḥ ca svādhyāyaḥ tapaḥ ārjavam
translated: Charity, self-control, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness,

original: ahiṃsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śāntir apaiśunam🔽dayā bhūteṣv aloluptvaṃ mārdavaṃ hrīr acāpalam
analyzed: ahiṃsā satyam akrodhaḥ tyāgaḥ śāntiḥ apaiśunam  dayā bhūteṣu a loluptvam mārdavam hrīḥ acāpalam
translated: Non-violence, truthfulness, freedom from anger, renunciation, tranquility, freedom from slander,🔽Compassion for living beings, freedom from greed, gentleness, modesty, and steadiness,

original: tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucam adroho nātimānitā
analyzed: tejaḥ kṣamā dhṛtiḥ śaucam adrohaḥ na atimāni tā
translated: Forbearance, forgiveness, purity, absence of malice, and freedom from haughtiness,

original: bhavanti saṃpadaṃ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata
analyzed: bhavanti saṃpadam daivīm abhijātasya bhārata
translated: These, O son of Bharata, are the qualities of one who is born with the divine nature.

original: dambho darpo 'timānaś ca krodhaḥ pāruṣyam eva ca
analyzed: dambhaḥ darpaḥ ti mānaḥ ca krodhaḥ pāruṣyam eva ca
translated: Arrogance, pride, vanity, anger, and harshness,

original: ajñānaṃ cābhijātasya pārtha saṃpadam āsurīm
analyzed: ajñānam ca abhijātasya pārtha saṃpadam āsurīm
translated: And ignorance, O son of Prtha, are the qualities of one who is born with the demoniac nature.

original: daivī saṃpad vimokṣāya nibandhāyāsurī matā
analyzed: daivī saṃpad vimokṣāya nibandhāya āsurī matā
translated: The divine nature is considered to lead to liberation, while the demoniac nature is considered to lead to bondage.

original: mā śucaḥ saṃpadaṃ daivīm abhijāto 'si pāṇḍava
analyzed: mā śucaḥ saṃpadam daivīm abhijātaḥ si pāṇḍava
translated: Do not grieve, for you are born with the divine nature, O son of Pandu.

original: dvau bhūtasargau loke 'smin daiva āsura eva ca
analyzed: dvau bhūta sargau loke smin daivaḥ āsuraḥ eva ca
translated: There are two kinds of creation of beings in this world, the divine and the demoniac.

original: daivo vistaraśaḥ prokta āsuraṃ pārtha me śṛṇu
analyzed: daivaḥ vistaraśaḥ proktaḥ āsuram pārtha me śṛṇu
translated: The divine has been described in detail. Listen to the demoniac, O son of Prtha.

original: pravṛttiṃ ca nivṛttiṃ ca janā na vidur āsurāḥ
analyzed: pravṛttim ca nivṛttim ca janāḥ na viduḥ āsurāḥ
translated: The demons do not know about engagement and disengagement.

original: na śaucaṃ nāpi cācāro na satyaṃ teṣu vidyate
analyzed: na śaucam na api ca ācāraḥ na satyam teṣu vidyate
translated: They have no purity, no conduct, and no truth.

original: asatyam apratiṣṭhaṃ te jagad āhur anīśvaram
analyzed: asatyam apratiṣṭham te jagat āhuḥ anīśvaram
translated: They say that this world is false, without support, without a Lord,

original: aparasparasaṃbhūtaṃ kim anyat kāmahaitukam🔽etāṃ dṛṣṭim avaṣṭabhya naṣṭātmāno 'lpabuddhayaḥ
analyzed: a paraspara saṃbhūtam kim anyat kāma haitukam  etām dṛṣṭim avaṣṭabhya naṣṭa ātmānaḥ lpabuddhayaḥ
translated: arisen from mutual contact, and nothing but the result of desire and passion.🔽Those whose souls are lost, whose intellect is small,

original: prabhavanty ugrakarmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagato 'hitāḥ🔽kāmam āśritya duṣpūraṃ dambhamānamadānvitāḥ
analyzed: prabhavanti ugra karmāṇaḥ kṣayāya jagataḥ hitāḥ  kāmam āśritya duṣpūram dambha māna mada anvitāḥ
translated: rely on this view, and they become of fierce deeds, harmful to the world, for its destruction.🔽Relying on desire, which is difficult to satisfy, full of pride, conceit, and intoxication,

original: mohād gṛhītvāsadgrāhān pravartante 'śucivratāḥ
analyzed: mohāt gṛhītvā asat grāhān pravartante śuci vratāḥ
translated: they, out of delusion, take up bad views and engage in impure conduct.

original: cintām aparimeyāṃ ca pralayāntām upāśritāḥ
analyzed: cintām aparimeyām ca pralaya antām upāśritāḥ
translated: They resort to immeasurable anxiety, ending only with death.

original: kāmopabhogaparamā etāvad iti niścitāḥ
analyzed: kāma upabhoga paramāḥ etāvat iti niścitāḥ
translated: They are certain that this much is the highest, the enjoyment of desire.

original: āśāpāśaśatair baddhāḥ kāmakrodhaparāyaṇāḥ
analyzed: āśā pāśa śataiḥ baddhāḥ kāma krodha parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Bound by hundreds of fetters of hope, devoted to desire and anger,

original: īhante kāmabhogārtham anyāyenārthasaṃcayān
analyzed: īhante kāma bhoga artham anyāyena artha saṃcayān
translated: they seek wealth for the sake of sensual enjoyment by unjust means.

original: idam adya mayā labdham idaṃ prāpsye manoratham
analyzed: idam adya mayā labdham idam prāpsye manoratham
translated: Today I have obtained this, I will obtain this desire,

original: idam astīdam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam
analyzed: idam asti idam api me bhaviṣyati punar dhanam
translated: this is mine, this wealth will be mine again,

original: asau mayā hataḥ śatrur haniṣye cāparān api
analyzed: asau mayā hataḥ śatruḥ haniṣye ca aparān api
translated: this enemy has been killed by me, I will kill others too,

original: īśvaro 'ham ahaṃ bhogī siddho 'haṃ balavān sukhī
analyzed: īśvaraḥ ham aham bhogī siddhaḥ ham balavān sukhī
translated: I am the Lord, I am the enjoyer, I am the successful one, I am powerful, I am happy,

original: āḍhyo 'bhijanavān asmi ko 'nyo 'sti sadṛśo mayā
analyzed: āḍhyaḥ asmi kaḥ sti sadṛśaḥ mayā
translated: I am rich, I am noble, who else is there like me?

original: yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣya ity ajñānavimohitāḥ
analyzed: yakṣye dāsyāmi modiṣye iti ajñāna vimohitāḥ
translated: I will sacrifice, I will give, I will rejoice, deluded by ignorance,

original: anekacittavibhrāntā mohajālasamāvṛtāḥ
analyzed: aneka citta vibhrāntāḥ moha jāla samāvṛtāḥ
translated: confused by many thoughts, covered by the net of delusion,

original: prasaktāḥ kāmabhogeṣu patanti narake 'śucau
analyzed: prasaktāḥ kāma bhogeṣu patanti narake śucau
translated: attached to the enjoyment of desires, they fall into an impure hell.

original: ātmasaṃbhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhanamānamadānvitāḥ
analyzed: ātma saṃbhāvitāḥ stabdhāḥ dhana māna mada anvitāḥ
translated: Conceited about themselves, arrogant, full of pride, vanity and intoxication,

original: yajante nāmayajñais te dambhenāvidhipūrvakam
analyzed: yajante nāma yajñaiḥ te dambhena a vidhi pūrvakam
translated: they worship with sacrifices that are mere name, out of hypocrisy and without proper procedure.

original: ahaṃkāraṃ balaṃ darpaṃ kāmaṃ krodhaṃ ca saṃśritāḥ
analyzed: ahaṃkāram balam darpam kāmam krodham ca saṃśritāḥ
translated: Relying on ego, power, pride, desire and anger,

original: mām ātmaparadeheṣu pradviṣanto 'bhyasūyakāḥ🔽tān ahaṃ dviṣataḥ krūrān saṃsāreṣu narādhamān
analyzed: mām ātma para deheṣu pradviṣantaḥ bhyasūyakāḥ  tān aham dviṣataḥ krūrān saṃsāreṣu nara adhamān
translated: hating me in their own and others' bodies, envious,🔽I cast those haters, the cruelest of men,

original: kṣipāmy ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣv eva yoniṣu
analyzed: kṣipāmi ajasram aśubhān āsurīṣu eva yoniṣu
translated: constantly into inauspicious births, into demon wombs alone.

original: āsurīṃ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani
analyzed: āsurīm yonim āpannāḥ mūḍhāḥ janmani janmani
translated: Born in demon wombs, deluded in birth after birth,

original: mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṃ gatim🔽trividhaṃ narakasyedaṃ dvāraṃ nāśanam ātmanaḥ
analyzed: mām a prāpya eva kaunteya tatas yānti adhamām gatim  trividham narakasya idam dvāram nāśanam ātmanaḥ
translated: not attaining me, O son of Kunti, they go to the lowest state.🔽This threefold is the door to hell, the destruction of the self:

original: kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṃ tyajet
analyzed: kāmaḥ krodhaḥ tathā lobhaḥ tasmāt etat trayam tyajet
translated: desire, anger and greed - therefore one should abandon this triad.

original: etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamodvārais tribhir naraḥ
analyzed: etaiḥ vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamaḥ dvāraiḥ tribhiḥ naraḥ
translated: O son of Kunti, the man who is free from these three doors of darkness

original: ācaraty ātmanaḥ śreyas tato yāti parāṃ gatim
analyzed: ācarati ātmanaḥ śreyaḥ tatas yāti parām gatim
translated: practices what is good for himself and then attains the supreme goal.

original: yaḥ śāstravidhim utsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ
analyzed: yaḥ śāstra vidhim utsṛjya vartate kāmakārataḥ
translated: He who, abandoning the injunction of scripture, acts according to his own will,

original: na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṃ na parāṃ gatim
analyzed: na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukham na parām gatim
translated: does not attain perfection, nor happiness, nor the supreme goal.

original: tasmāc chāstraṃ pramāṇaṃ te kāryākāryavyavasthitau
analyzed: tasmāt śāstram pramāṇam te kārya akārya vyavasthitau
translated: Therefore, scripture is the authority for you in determining what should and should not be done.

original: jñātvā śāstravidhānoktaṃ karma kartum ihārhasi
analyzed: jñātvā śāstra vidhāna uktam karma kartum iha arhasi
translated: Having understood what is stated in the scriptures, you should perform your duties here.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: ye śāstravidhim utsṛjya yajante śraddhayānvitāḥ
analyzed: ye śāstra vidhim utsṛjya yajante śraddhayā anvitāḥ
translated: Those who, abandoning the injunction of scripture, worship with faith,

original: teṣāṃ niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvam āho rajas tamaḥ
analyzed: teṣām niṣṭhā tu kā kṛṣṇa sattvam āho rajaḥ tamaḥ
translated: what is their goal, O Krishna, is it goodness, passion or darkness?

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: trividhā bhavati śraddhā dehināṃ sā svabhāvajā
analyzed: trividhā bhavati śraddhā dehinām sā svabhāva jā
translated: Faith of embodied beings is of three kinds, born of their own nature.

original: sāttvikī rājasī caiva tāmasī ceti tāṃ śṛṇu
analyzed: sāttvikī rājasī ca eva tāmasī ca iti tām śṛṇu
translated: Listen to it, as it is of the quality of goodness, passion and darkness.

original: sattvānurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata
analyzed: sattva anurūpā sarvasya śraddhā bhavati bhārata
translated: O descendant of Bharata, everyone's faith is in accordance with his own nature.

original: śraddhāmayo 'yaṃ puruṣo yo yacchraddhaḥ sa eva saḥ
analyzed: śraddhā mayaḥ yam puruṣaḥ yaḥ yad śraddhaḥ saḥ eva saḥ
translated: This person is full of faith; he is just as he has faith.

original: yajante sāttvikā devān yakṣarakṣāṃsi rājasāḥ
analyzed: yajante sāttvikāḥ devān yakṣa rakṣāṃsi rājasāḥ
translated: Those of the quality of goodness worship the gods, those of passion the Yakshas and Rakshasas,

original: pretān bhūtagaṇāṃś cānye yajante tāmasā janāḥ
analyzed: pretān bhūta gaṇān ca anye yajante tāmasāḥ janāḥ
translated: and other people of the quality of darkness worship the ghosts and various spirits.

original: aśāstravihitaṃ ghoraṃ tapyante ye tapo janāḥ
analyzed: a śāstra vihitam ghoram tapyante ye tapaḥ janāḥ
translated: Those people who practice terrible austerities not prescribed by the scriptures,

original: dambhāhaṃkārasaṃyuktāḥ kāmarāgabalānvitāḥ
analyzed: dambha ahaṃkāra saṃyuktāḥ kāma rāga bala anvitāḥ
translated: who are full of hypocrisy and pride, and endowed with the power of lust and passion,

original: karśayantaḥ śarīrasthaṃ bhūtagrāmam acetasaḥ
analyzed: karśayantaḥ śarīra stham bhūta grāmam acetasaḥ
translated: who, being devoid of consciousness, torment the group of elements in the body,

original: māṃ caivāntaḥśarīrasthaṃ tān viddhy āsuraniścayān
analyzed: mām ca eva antar śarīra stham tān viddhi āsura niścayān
translated: and who consider Me as dwelling within the body - know them to be of demoniacal resolve.

original: āhāras tv api sarvasya trividho bhavati priyaḥ
analyzed: āhāraḥ tu api sarvasya trividhaḥ bhavati priyaḥ
translated: Moreover, the food of all is of three kinds and is liked:

original: yajñas tapas tathā dānaṃ teṣāṃ bhedam imaṃ śṛṇu🔽āyuḥsattvabalārogyasukhaprītivivardhanāḥ
analyzed: yajñaḥ tapaḥ tathā dānam teṣām bhedam imam śṛṇu  āyuḥ sattva bala ārogya sukha prīti vivardhanāḥ
translated: Sacrifice, austerity, and charity - listen to the division of these.🔽Those which increase life, goodness, strength, health, happiness, and joy,

original: rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirā hṛdyā āhārāḥ sāttvikapriyāḥ
analyzed: rasyāḥ snigdhāḥ sthirāḥ hṛdyāḥ āhārāḥ sāttvika priyāḥ
translated: which are pleasant, unctuous, firm, and agreeable - such food is liked by the virtuous.

original: kaṭvamlalavaṇātyuṣṇatīkṣṇarūkṣavidāhinaḥ
translated: Food which is pungent, sour, salty, very hot, sharp, rough, and burning,

original: āhārā rājasasyeṣṭā duḥkhaśokāmayapradāḥ
analyzed: āhārāḥ rājasasya iṣṭāḥ duḥkha śoka āmaya pradāḥ
translated: is liked by the passionate, and gives rise to suffering, grief, and disease.

original: yātayāmaṃ gatarasaṃ pūti paryuṣitaṃ ca yat
analyzed: yātayāmam gata rasam pūti paryuṣitam ca yat
translated: What is stale, tasteless, putrid, and old,

original: ucchiṣṭam api cāmedhyaṃ bhojanaṃ tāmasapriyam
analyzed: ucchiṣṭam api ca amedhyam bhojanam tāmasa priyam
translated: what is left over and impure - such food is liked by the ignorant.

original: aphalākāṅkṣibhir yajño vidhidṛṣṭo ya ijyate
analyzed: a phala ākāṅkṣibhiḥ yajñaḥ vidhi dṛṣṭaḥ yaḥ ijyate
translated: A sacrifice performed without desire for results, according to the prescribed method,

original: yaṣṭavyam eveti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
analyzed: yaṣṭavyam eva iti manaḥ samādhāya sa sāttvikaḥ
translated: with a mind fixed on the thought that it must be done - that is of the virtuous.

original: abhisaṃdhāya tu phalaṃ dambhārtham api caiva yat
analyzed: abhisaṃdhāya tu phalam dambha artham api ca eva yat
translated: But that which is performed with a view to results, and even for the sake of hypocrisy,

original: ijyate bharataśreṣṭha taṃ yajñaṃ viddhi rājasam🔽vidhihīnam asṛṣṭānnaṃ mantrahīnam adakṣiṇam
analyzed: ijyate bharata śreṣṭha tam yajñam viddhi rājasam  vidhi hīnam a sṛṣṭa annam mantra hīnam a dakṣiṇam
translated: O best of the Bharatas, that sacrifice is known as Rajas, where the Brahmanas are not well-versed in the Vedas, the priests are not well-versed in the Vedas, and the sacrificer is not well-versed in the Vedas.🔽That sacrifice which is devoid of injunctions, where food is not properly prepared, where there are no mantras, and where no sacrificial fees are given,

original: śraddhāvirahitaṃ yajñaṃ tāmasaṃ paricakṣate
analyzed: śraddhā virahitam yajñam tāmasam paricakṣate
translated: and which is devoid of faith, is said to be of the tamas-type.

original: devadvijaguruprājñapūjanaṃ śaucam ārjavam
analyzed: deva dvija guru prājña pūjanam śaucam ārjavam
translated: Worship of gods, Brahmanas, preceptors and the wise, purity, straightforwardness,

original: brahmacaryam ahiṃsā ca śārīraṃ tapa ucyate
analyzed: brahmacaryam ahiṃsā ca śārīram tapaḥ ucyate
translated: celibacy and non-violence are said to be bodily austerities.

original: anudvegakaraṃ vākyaṃ satyaṃ priyahitaṃ ca yat
analyzed: an udvega karam vākyam satyam priya hitam ca yat
translated: Speech that does not cause distress, truth, what is pleasant and beneficial,

original: svādhyāyābhyasanaṃ caiva vāṅmayaṃ tapa ucyate
analyzed: svādhyāya abhyasanam ca eva vāc mayam tapaḥ ucyate
translated: and the practice of self-study - these are said to be verbal austerities.

original: manaḥprasādaḥ saumyatvaṃ maunam ātmavinigrahaḥ
translated: Tranquility of the mind, gentleness, silence, self-control,

original: bhāvasaṃśuddhir ity etat tapo mānasam ucyate
analyzed: bhāva saṃśuddhiḥ iti etat tapaḥ mānasam ucyate
translated: and purification of thoughts - these are said to be mental austerities.

original: śraddhayā parayā taptaṃ tapas tat trividhaṃ naraiḥ
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā taptam tapaḥ tat trividham naraiḥ
translated: That austerity which is performed by men with supreme faith, in these three ways,

original: aphalākāṅkṣibhir yuktaiḥ sāttvikaṃ paricakṣate🔽satkāramānapūjārthaṃ tapo dambhena caiva yat
analyzed: a phala ākāṅkṣibhiḥ yuktaiḥ sāttvikam paricakṣate  satkāra māna pūjā artham tapaḥ dambhena ca eva yat
translated: without desire for results, and with proper application, is said to be of the sattva-type.

original: kriyate tad iha proktaṃ rājasaṃ calam adhruvam
analyzed: kriyate tat iha proktam rājasam calam adhruvam
translated: That austerity which is performed for the sake of honor, respect and worship, and out of vanity, is said to be of the rajas-type here, unstable and impermanent.

original: mūḍhagrāheṇātmano yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ
analyzed: mūḍha grāheṇa ātmanaḥ yat pīḍayā kriyate tapaḥ
translated: That austerity which is performed out of delusion, by afflicting oneself,

original: parasyotsādanārthaṃ vā tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
analyzed: parasya utsādana artham vā tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
translated: or for the destruction of others, is said to be of the tamas-type.

original: dātavyam iti yad dānaṃ dīyate 'nupakāriṇe
analyzed: dātavyam iti yat dānam dīyate n upakāriṇe
translated: That gift which is given with the thought 'it should be given' to one who does not render help,

original: deśe kāle ca pātre ca tad dānaṃ sāttvikaṃ smṛtam
analyzed: deśe kāle ca pātre ca tat dānam sāttvikam smṛtam
translated: in the right place, at the right time, and to a worthy recipient, that gift is said to be of the sattva quality.

original: yat tu pratyupakārārthaṃ phalam uddiśya vā punaḥ
analyzed: yat tu pratyupakāra artham phalam uddiśya vā punar
translated: But that which is given with the thought of return or of reward,

original: dīyate ca parikliṣṭaṃ tad dānaṃ rājasaṃ smṛtam🔽adeśakāle yad dānam apātrebhyaś ca dīyate
analyzed: dīyate ca parikliṣṭam tat dānam rājasam smṛtam  a deśa kāle yat dānam apātrebhyaḥ ca dīyate
translated: and which is given with difficulty, that gift is said to be of the rajas quality.🔽That gift which is given at the wrong place, at the wrong time, and to unworthy recipients,

original: asatkṛtam avajñātaṃ tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
analyzed: asatkṛtam avajñātam tat tāmasam udāhṛtam
translated: and which is given without respect and with contempt, that is said to be of the tamas quality.

original: oṃ tat sad iti nirdeśo brahmaṇas trividhaḥ smṛtaḥ
analyzed: om tat sat iti nirdeśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ trividhaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: Om, tat, and sat - these are declared to be the three names of Brahman.

original: brāhmaṇās tena vedāś ca yajñāś ca vihitāḥ purā
analyzed: brāhmaṇāḥ tena vedāḥ ca yajñāḥ ca vihitāḥ purā
translated: By that, the Brahmanas, the Vedas, and the sacrifices were created in the past.

original: tasmād om ity udāhṛtya yajñadānatapaḥkriyāḥ
analyzed: tasmāt om iti udāhṛtya yajña dāna tapaḥ kriyāḥ
translated: Therefore, having uttered Om, the rites of sacrifice, charity, and austerity,

original: pravartante vidhānoktāḥ satataṃ brahmavādinām
analyzed: pravartante vidhāna uktāḥ satatam brahma vādinām
translated: which are prescribed by the rules, are always performed by those who proclaim Brahman.

original: tad ity anabhisaṃdhāya phalaṃ yajñatapaḥkriyāḥ
analyzed: tat iti an abhisaṃdhāya phalam yajña tapaḥ kriyāḥ
translated: Without aiming at a result, the rites of sacrifice, austerity,

original: dānakriyāś ca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣakāṅkṣibhiḥ
analyzed: dāna kriyāḥ ca vividhāḥ kriyante mokṣa kāṅkṣibhiḥ
translated: and various acts of charity are performed by those who desire liberation, with the word tat.

original: sadbhāve sādhubhāve ca sad ity etat prayujyate
analyzed: sadbhāve sādhu bhāve ca sat iti etat prayujyate
translated: The word sat is used to denote good existence and good nature.

original: praśaste karmaṇi tathā sacchabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
analyzed: praśaste karmaṇi tathā sat śabdaḥ pārtha yujyate
translated: And the word sat is used, O son of Prtha, in praiseworthy actions.

original: yajñe tapasi dāne ca sthitiḥ sad iti cocyate
analyzed: yajñe tapasi dāne ca sthitiḥ sat iti ca ucyate
translated: Abiding in sacrifice, austerity, and charity is called sat.

original: karma caiva tadarthīyaṃ sad ity evābhidhīyate
analyzed: karma ca eva tad arthīyam sat iti eva abhidhīyate
translated: And the action that is for that purpose is indeed said to be good.

original: aśraddhayā hutaṃ dattaṃ tapas taptaṃ kṛtaṃ ca yat
analyzed: aśraddhayā hutam dattam tapaḥ taptam kṛtam ca yat
translated: What is offered, given, or austerities performed without faith,

original: asad ity ucyate pārtha na ca tat pretya no iha
analyzed: asat iti ucyate pārtha na ca tat pretya no iha
translated: is said to be not good, O Partha, and it does not exist after death or in this world.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: saṃnyāsasya mahābāho tattvam icchāmi veditum
analyzed: saṃnyāsasya mahā bāho tattvam icchāmi veditum
translated: O mighty-armed one, I wish to know the truth about renunciation,

original: tyāgasya ca hṛṣīkeśa pṛthak keśiniṣūdana
analyzed: tyāgasya ca hṛṣīkeśa pṛthak keśiniṣūdana
translated: and about abandonment, O Hrishikesha, O slayer of Keshi.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: kāmyānāṃ karmaṇāṃ nyāsaṃ saṃnyāsaṃ kavayo viduḥ
analyzed: kāmyānām karmaṇām nyāsam saṃnyāsam kavayaḥ viduḥ
translated: The wise know renunciation to be the giving up of the results of actions that are done for the sake of desire.

original: sarvakarmaphalatyāgaṃ prāhus tyāgaṃ vicakṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: sarva karma phala tyāgam prāhuḥ tyāgam vicakṣaṇāḥ
translated: The wise say that the giving up of the results of all actions is abandonment.

original: tyājyaṃ doṣavad ity eke karma prāhur manīṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: tyājyam doṣavat iti eke karma prāhuḥ manīṣiṇaḥ
translated: Some wise ones say that action should be abandoned as faulty.

original: yajñadānatapaḥkarma na tyājyam iti cāpare
analyzed: yajña dāna tapaḥ karma na tyājyam iti ca apare
translated: Others say that the action of sacrifice, charity, and austerity should not be abandoned, but should be performed.

original: niścayaṃ śṛṇu me tatra tyāge bharatasattama
analyzed: niścayam śṛṇu me tatra tyāge bharata sattama
translated: Listen to my conclusion on that, O best of the Bharata lineage,

original: tyāgo hi puruṣavyāghra trividhaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ
analyzed: tyāgaḥ hi puruṣa vyāghra trividhaḥ saṃprakīrtitaḥ
translated: for renunciation, O tiger among men, is declared to be of three kinds.

original: yajñadānatapaḥkarma na tyājyaṃ kāryam eva tat
analyzed: yajña dāna tapaḥ karma na tyājyam kāryam eva tat
